Description: Weight: fals weight of 27 kharrūba. Six line inscription. Made of green glass.
Curator's comments: From the same die: Nies, James Buchanan. 1902. Kufic glass weights and bottle stamps. ‘Proceedings of the American Numismatic and Archaeological Society’. New York, 11 = Miles, G.C. 1948. ‘Early Arabic Weights and Stamps’. New York, 74; Fahmi, A. 1957. ‘Sinaj al-sikka fī fajr al-Islām’. Cairo, 132. Cf. Launois, Aimée. 1957. Estampilles et poids faibles en verre Omeyyades et Abbasides au Musée Arabe du Caire, ‘Mélanges islamologiques’ III, 181; Fahmi 1957, 133-4.

All of Muḥammad b. al-Ashʿath's known fals weights are of 27 kharrūba. Of the three dies, the two with ʿAbdallah b. Rāshid as executive are represented in the British Museum's collection. Miles (1964, 34) has described a specimen from a third die without an executive's name. Bibliography: Miles, G.C. 1964. Early Islamic weights and measures in the Muntaza Palace, Alexandria. ‘Journal of the American Research Centre in Egypt’ III. Cairo.
Bibliographic references: Morton 1985 / A Catalogue of Early Islamic Glass Stamps (217)
